alert.note: Alert for San Miguel; Torrance (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 26 at 3:13PM MDT until May 26 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... Northeastern Torrance County in central New Mexico... * Until 400 PM MDT. * At 312 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 10 miles southwest of Clines Corners, or 13 miles southeast of Moriarty, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and hail up to two inches in diameter. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Clines Corners around 340 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 208 and 229. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 235 and 251. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: Motorists should not take shelter under highway overpasses. If you cannot safely drive away from the tornado, as a last resort, either park your vehicle and stay put, or abandon your vehicle and lie down in a low lying area and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
